title: 13+ Survival Gardening Crops To Grow To Live Off Your Garden

tasks.task: Growing a survival garden to be self-sufficient in food.
subtasks: Planting sweet potatoes (including both the tubers and greens as a nutrient source).
Planting cassava/yucca and cooking to remove toxic compounds.
Planting yams (drought-tolerant and calorie-dense variety) and managing vining growth.
Growing bananas and plantains for fruit and potential use of leaves.
Cultivating heat-loving squashes (e.g., 'seminal' pumpkins) for calorie and nutrient intake.
Planting pigeon peas as a perennial protein source.
Growing ground cover legumes (e.g., southern peas) for nitrogen fixation.
Producing perennial greens (moringa, katuk, chaya) and preserving dried forms.
Planting food trees like papaya and securing abundant vegetable crops (e.g., zucchini/pumpkin).
Innovative uses of garden produce (e.g., fermenting papaya).

tasks.task: Creating a specialized survival garden with nutrient-dense foods.
subtasks: Incorporating moringa and other nitrogen-fixing perennials.
Raising caterpillar food for additional protein sources.
Using herbs for flavor and pollinator attraction.

tasks.task: Enhancing the garden's ecosystem for sustained production.
subtasks: Growing daikon radish for ground cover and nutrient cycling.
Incorporating tomatoes for intense heat climates.
Planting garlic or onions for flavor and health benefits.

tasks.task: Diversifying crops for flavor and nutrition in survival gardens.
